intro: Fadogia grandiflora, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive crown-like structure, which attract pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
